answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
During my career, I have authored policies and procedures for several public organizations and updated existing ones for local governments, and for what it is worth while it may seem cumbersome it is better over all to not separate the two.  This is primarily because they are so inter-connected and to separate them usually results in confusion and conflict over interpretation and actual meaning.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is looking to update the format of its policies and procedures, and will be introducing electronic document workflow to facilitate this. A key issue is whether to completely separate the policy and procedure documents. They are  also  interested in the review process an agency goes through before having the City Manager adopt policies/procedures.
